comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330 (Ubuntu version : 3.2.2-0Ubuntu3)

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Go to help->Helps Contents
2.Choose Workbench User Guide->Getting started->Basic tutorial 
3.Choose Editors and views->Editors


More information:
Error displayed :

The content producer for this document encountered an internal error while processing the document.

gnu.xml.dom.DomDOMException: The node doesn't belong here.
More Information: document type already present: gnu.xml.dom.DomDoctype[html]
Node Name: html
   at gnu.xml.dom.DomDocument.checkNewChild(libgcj.so.70)
   at gnu.xml.dom.DomDocument.insertBefore(libgcj.so.70)
   at gnu.xml.transform.TransformerImpl.transform(libgcj.so.70)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.xhtml.UATransformManager.convertToString(UATransformManager.java:75)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.xhtml.UATransformManager.getAsInputStream(UATransformManager.java:91)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.DynamicContentProducer.openXHTMLFromPlugin(DynamicContentProducer.java:126)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.DynamicContentProducer.getInputStream(DynamicContentProducer.java:53)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.util.ResourceLocator.openFromProducer(ResourceLocator.java:227)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.protocols.HelpURLConnection.getInputStream(HelpURLConnection.java:113)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.webapp.servlet.EclipseConnector.transfer(EclipseConnector.java:88)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.webapp.servlet.ContentServlet.doGet(ContentServlet.java:42)
   at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:689)
   at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:802)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:252)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:173)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapperValve.invoke(StandardWrapperValve.java:213)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContextValve.invoke(StandardContextValve.java:178)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke(StandardHostValve.java:126)
   at org.eclipse.tomcat.internal.EclipseErrorReportValve.invoke(EclipseErrorReportValve.java:165)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke(StandardEngineValve.java:107)
   at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteAdapter.service(CoyoteAdapter.java:148)
   at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.process(Http11Processor.java:869)
   at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11BaseProtocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.processConnection(Http11BaseProtocol.java:664)

   at java.lang.Thread.run(libgcj.so.70)
Can you reproduce this consistently? Do you happen to know which JRE you are using? If it is a GNU JRE that could be the cause of your problems.
